column4: could someone help me, this is starting to anoy me a lot, i tryed everything but i simply can't insall kubuntu on my laptop.. any ideas ?
what happens when you try to install it?
well i get an error... and root witouth gui
you might try doing a normal ubuntu install (rather than kubuntu), and then install the kde desktop.  The end result is the same as a kubuntu install
if you have problems even doing that, then use the text mode install on the alternate cd, then install the desktop as a second phase.
download the ubuntu cd, and/or the alternate cd
probably it's the alternate cd that will solve your problem.
I would recommend downloading the alternate cd.  The text mode install, followed by the desktop install as phase 2, is the best way to deal with your situation.
is there a loaded module name "usb-storage"?
i think i saw that modul loaded
check.  If it is loaded, then my theory is wrong.
use dmesg instead of tail /var/log/messages.  See if you see messages from usb-storage, and a reference to a SCSI drive.
do you possibly have a non-standard kernel configuration?
no, everything is standard, i found some forums with people having same problem like mine on this laptop.. they cant fix it i think :S

using the text mode install is usually the key to this type of situation.  The full install works with a much larger range of video hardware.  So when the GUI install fails, the text mode install succeeds, and then the more powerful installation/configuration programs for the KDE (or gnome, or whatever) desktop can be used.
you boot the alternate cd, and text mode install is one of the boot menu options.  extremely easy, once you download it.
you'll find instructions at the download site on ubuntu.com
